186013603.review: Resident Evil HD Remaster emerges as a masterful revival of a survival horror classic, offering both longtime fans and newcomers an intensely atmospheric journey through the iconic Spencer Mansion. This remastered version brilliantly preserves the original's terrifying essence while introducing modern gameplay refinements, such as optional updated controls and multiple display options that make the experience more accessible without sacrificing the game's core tension. The game's meticulously crafted environment remains a triumph of design, with fixed camera angles that transform each corridor into a potential nightmare and create an unparalleled sense of claustrophobic dread. Its resource management mechanics continue to set the standard for survival horror, forcing players to make strategic decisions about ammunition, health items, and exploration that elevate every encounter from simple combat to a nerve-wracking psychological challenge. The introduction of mechanics like the Crimson Head zombies adds an additional layer of strategic depth, ensuring that players can never truly feel safe and must carefully consider how they dispatch each enemy. While the visual upgrades might not be revolutionary, the atmospheric lighting, carefully preserved pre-rendered backgrounds, and the game's fundamental design create an experience that remains as compelling and frightening now as it was during its original release, proving that true horror transcends technological limitations.

185917964.review: There's something about Resident Evil that not many other games in the franchise really lived up to. Capcom really mastered the art of survival horror in this game. It doesn't bombard you with a horde of zombies that you have to take down. Instead, the atmosphere is kept tense with only some zombies spread out throughout the entire mansion. It keeps you spooked without any cheap jump scares. That's what I think makes a great horror game. As much as I love this game, it can be a little hard to handle because of its tank controls. There's also a 3-second door animation that plays every time you enter or exit a room, which can get a little annoying, but there is a mod to get rid of that. Overall, Resident Evil is an amazing game that I recommend all horror fans to play.

185856013.review:
生化危机1 实话说 已经游玩了太多次，无论是早先的原版还是后来的重制版。关于重制版，其实早先有点排斥，感觉部分内容有点偏离原版的味道，96、97年在国内流行的原版 的的确确给当时的我和同时期的太多同学以深刻的震撼，那是游戏画面由2D向3D转变的风口期 也是白金期 黄金期 PS一代主机在国内可谓大行其道 而生化危机1的爆火 不仅在日本 还是在日本海外 都为该系列后来发展为业界长青IP奠定了扎实基础 今年 我又重拾了生化危机1重制版（2020年购买 当时仅通关吉尔普通篇） 先后通关吉尔、克里斯困难篇 和吉尔真实难度篇，猛然间发现重制版的改编依然能够抓住老玩家的心 对部分内容的重置又重新抱以理解和赞许 这应是经典IP的魅力使然。在重温了回眸一吓、狗急破窗、猎手追捕等原版经典场景后，不得不感叹时间走得真快 而游戏中那些经典瞬间历经时间洗礼依然在重制版中得以保留并焕发魅力，确实令人感叹 也带着一点点惋惜。那些儿时的玩伴，现在都去了哪里，他们的生活依然如意吗？每当我偶然看到库中的生化危机1 第一时间想到的不是游戏的内容本身，而是少年时的我和伙伴游玩的场景。即便重制版确实优秀，我还是觉得96年的原版更有味道，那是开山之作，也是经典之作，更是心目中最佳的生化ip。
不管怎样，生化危机1原版还是重制版 都高居游戏版前三的位置，如果一定要排个先后顺序，仅列在围棋之后，位列第二。生化危机1不仅仅是一个游戏，还是一段岁月，一个还未被唤醒的梦。
多年以后，在游玩时忽然领悟，游戏中凄惨鸣叫的乌鸦 原来是制作人向美国惊悚电影大师希区柯克致敬。噫嘘唏！岁月不再，经典仍在继续 这便是生化危机1的魅力。

另提一下，1.17 真实难度通关 世界排名是12000左右，今天看了下 却到了26000 看来全球有相当数量的玩家竟然执著于时间纪录 那就这样吧...

185693224.review:
The Resident Evil HD Remaster is the definitive way to experience the survival horror classic that started it all. 
Originally released in 1996, this version takes the masterpiece to new heights with updated visuals, refined controls, and subtle improvements that modernize the game while respecting its roots.
Set in the eerie Spencer Mansion, the game follows S.T.A.R.S. members Chris Redfield and Jill Valentine as they unravel the secrets of a biohazardous nightmare. 
The remaster retains the claustrophobic atmosphere and spine-chilling tension of the original, amplified by its meticulously crafted environments and haunting sound design.
The graphics upgrade is stunning, with sharper textures, enhanced lighting, and reimagined details that make the mansion feel alive and more terrifying than ever. 
Whether it’s the flickering of a dimly lit corridor or the grotesque detail of a zombie’s rotting face, every element pulls you deeper into the horror.
The updated controls are a welcome addition, giving players the option to choose between the traditional tank controls and a modernized scheme. 
This makes the game more accessible without losing the deliberate pacing that’s essential to its tension.
The puzzles, resource management, and limited saves are all intact, keeping the survival horror elements challenging and rewarding. 
Every bullet counts, and every encounter is a test of strategy and nerves.
Resident Evil HD Remaster is a love letter to fans of the series and a fantastic entry point for newcomers. 
It proves that even decades later, the foundations of survival horror are as effective as ever.
A timeless classic reborn, this is survival horror at its finest.

185681563.review:
This is unfortunately one of those games that I'm gonna have to give up on before really giving it a proper chance. I'll have to wait for the remake to play it because this is just too clunky for me, especially since I didn't grow up with the franchise and have never had to deal with similar mechanics. It's an old game of course which excuses the technical limitations of the time, but that doesn't mean that it has aged well.

Things that I don't like:
-It feels like there's no point in using the handgun. I have however never fought any bosses or any other enemies than the regular zombies so I'm not convinced that it's useless.
-Dodging zombies feels really inconsistent. I know that you're supposed to get close enough for them to lunge at you and then run past them while they're in "recovery". This works, but only sometimes. Every once in a while they just never enter recovery mode so you're forced to take a hit anyway or waste a defensive item.
-The fixed camera angles make it difficult to understand where you are and where you're going as well as the dimensions of the area that you're currently in. This makes it feel like you're forced to use the tank controls if you want to move normally between cameras which makes it pointless to add modern controls (character moves in the direction that you're pressing). I don't know how many times I've ran into a wall because I couldn't see what was right in front of my character.
-At least I haven't found it, but there's no "memory/note" system that puts a note on the map saying what kind of key item you're missing like there are in the modern titles. This means that unless you memorize everything or write it all down, you're gonna end up running back and forth between places because you didn't remember that you had to use one key item while having another.
-Ink ribbons as a concept is annoying. I understand that the concept of them is that you're supposed to be punished for making mistakes, but the first playthrough is just a bunch of trial and error which means that you'll have to play the same thing over and over again just because you ran out of ink ribbons. The worst part about them however is that they take up an inventory slot while you're already limited to 6 or 8 spaces (depending on character). Add key items to that and you'll have next to no space for consumables.

I'm not saying that you shouldn't give it a go yourself. You might actually end up enjoying it and I wish I could too, but it's just not a game for me.

185540431.review:
This is my entry title in RE I think it has a few notable flaws but otherwise I think it's a good horror classic. I think the game does a good job spooking you with its atmosphere and sound design. Gameplay wise it has nice replay value as you play as both Jill and Chris on separate playthroughs and unlock stuff as you finish a run; it's also a good game to try to speed run as you get better at dodging zombies and enemies.

The only issues I had with these game are: 
1. It's very confusing starting out, I tried my first blind playthrough very lost wandering rooms and getting killed as I'm not used to a game like this; I prefer more linear style games. 
2. The door animation for each area you enter gets old really fast. I highly recommend installing a mod to skip it
3. If you have arachnophobia like me I HIGHLY RECOMMEND either installing a mod to either remove all the spider enemies or to watch a walkthrough so you know when the spiders show up. The spiders here are LARGE and HAIRY! I jumped when I first got startled by the 'jump scare' angles.

185270661.review:
A video game remake done right.

It is a shame that it has been over 20 years, and this game still holds the crown of how to properly remake a game.

For one, if you played the original 1996 game, you will feel very familar with how this game plays. There's extremely minute changes to the gameplay and as such, veterans will be able to sink right in. I cannot stress how important this is for remaking a video game. DON'T ALTER THE CORE GAMEPLAY!

Secondly, the additions that were made didn't subtract from the experience. For example, you can now hold self-defense items that can save you from being chomped on by a zombie - a tool mostly meant for newbie players that may have difficulty juking through enemies. 

But then there's the Crimson Head mechanic - if you put down a zombie, after a certain amount of time, they will reanimate into a redder, faster, and more dangerous zombie. Now, if you know anything about the pre-RE4 Resident Evil games, killing monsters is secondary to the main gameplay of just getting from A to B. The monsters are just mere obstacles in your path, so you shouldn't really be spending resources killing them. The Remake decides to punish players who do with Crimson Heads. Again, mostly there for newbies. 

Veterans of the original game will have little trouble with this Remake albeit for maybe Lisa - one of the other additions of the Remake, and I would argue its worst one. With Lisa's addition came a few brand new areas and the boss character herself. I personally feel it needlessly elongates the game a bit (not anything too severe. You can still beat this game in less than 2 hours if you know what you're doing). While I don't like Lisa's addition, at least it doesn't overstay its welcome and most of all, it doesn't radically change the gameplay mechanics to something that the original never had you do. 

I of course recommend this game without question. If you liked the 1996 game and want to see it graphically enhanced, experience tighter controls, and hear better voice-acting (alas no meme-worthy Jill Sandwiches this time), pick this game up. 
If you're new to the series or have never played this specific entry before, I also recommend it if you are looking for a fun little maze/puzzle-box game to solve. While the tank-control movement may take getting used to, you can also use the Altermate Controls (but take heed: whenever the camera angle switches, you might need to jerk your analog stick in a different direction for your character to move correctly). Just know that the enemies you encounter (especially early on in the game) aren't worth wasting your ammo on. It's more about just getting from A to B: use this item to unlock a door so you can get a new item to unlock another door somewhere else.

I really wish Capcom would look back at this Remake and use it as the guide on how to make their future remakes, because... good lord. Those new remakes are so half-assed and barely even capture what made the originals liked to begin with.

Но ремейк второй части всё же куда лучше собран.

Это первая игра в серии. Тут мало врагов. Основная часть врагов это зомби, классические, и пёсики. Да, потом всё же немного добавляется, но этого не много. есть несколько акул (несколько это две), есть немного хантеров (немного это штук 5-6 гдет), пара пауков (пара это три), и под конец в лабе еще нападють таракны переростки (нападают это штук 8-9). Плюс боссы, которые вообще не являються откровением, если вам не 8 годиков. Но это само по себе не проблема.

Основная и главная проблема состоит из двух частей (как шампунь). Очень ограниченный инвентарь, и наварачивание кругов по локациям. Ё-б-а-ны-й тетрис с предметами в инвентаре в 8 ячеек, это жепа. И вот вы бегаете, наварачиваете километраж по локациям, и в кое то веки очередная дверь наканец открывается, вы наканец можете выбросить целый ключ, и освободить одну ячейку инвентаря. Если сравнить это с ремейком второй, то там формально было тоже самое. Но инвентарь был больше, а многие сюжетные предметы довольно быстро исполняли несколько своих действий и их можно было убрать или выкинуть. В итоге принцип тот же, но баланс сильно динамичнее, и сильно меньше наворотов кругов из за ограничено инвентаря. И это еще у Джилл, у которой 8 ячеек. У Криса вроде 6, что еще большая жепа.

Кадато на  Пк вышел первый ревелейшен, и всякие упыри, теребонькающие фасолинку на типа "сурвайвал хорор" очень его хвалили. Типа он в духе первых частей, а не в дуже 5 и 6, которые тупо экшон. Ведь ЭКШОН это что-то очень плохое, и не достойное, верно? Так вот, в ревилейшене экшона заметно больше, вполне в себе в духе 4 части. А вот тут и правда экшона очень мало. Но зато дох.р.е.нища тетриса в грёбаном инвентаре.

И канечно же КАМЕРА. Да, да, мы всё понимаем, старые технологии, попытка сделать эффект на пользу атмосфере и всё такое. Но камера тут, и переходы между ними это вторая половинка слоновей жепы.

В итоге мы получаем жепу о двух половинках. Одна про камеру, вторая про тетрис в инвентаре, вынуждающий наворачивать круги. Хорора тут нет. Если вам канешна не 4 годика. Сурвайвала тут тоже не густо. У меня осталось до х р е на травы и патронов. Канешна на последующих сложностях, которые теперь откроються будет посложнее, но суть принцепеально не меняется. Как первая игра серии - вполне себе нормально. Но дальше серия пошла в сторону экшона, и правильно сделала. Даже хваленые и "атмосферные" ревилейшены экшоновей и бодрей. 

Каданить возможно перепройду за Криса КраснуюПоляну. Возможно даже заморочусь и попытаюсь пройти за 5 или 3 часа. А возможно и не заморочусь.

И если вы гоняли в ремастер 4 части, в ремейк 4 части, в ремейке 2 и 3 частей, в 5 и 6, в похождения Итана Винтерса в двух частях, то все они лучше и интересней. Все они берут основу президента и пересобирают её в более интересном и бодром виде. 

По скидону брать можно.

185208257.review:
Resident Evil 1 Remake - A Timeless Classic That Still Delivers
Score: 8/10

The Resident Evil 1 Remake is a perfect example of how to breathe new life into a classic while staying true to its roots. Despite being an older game, it still holds up remarkably well, thanks to its excellent design and atmosphere.

The visuals are a standout feature. The character models look fantastic, even by today’s standards, and the game exudes a cozy yet terrifying vibe. The Spencer Mansion is a masterpiece of design, blending haunting shadows and eerie silence with sudden bursts of tension that keep you on edge throughout.

One of the game’s strengths lies in its ability to deliver genuine scares. Even if you’re a veteran gamer, you’ll likely find yourself startled by many moments. The horror is enhanced by the game’s focus on survival—scarce resources, limited saves, and enemies that can be relentless add to the tension.

However, the difficulty can be a double-edged sword. For newcomers or players unfamiliar with the original, the puzzles can feel overwhelming at times. Personally, I found the puzzles challenging but rewarding, though they occasionally broke the flow of the game. Still, their presence adds to the mystery and sense of accomplishment when solved.

The story is another strong point. It’s full of mystery, intriguing characters, and twists that keep you invested. As a fan of horror narratives, I’d love to see more stories like this one in future games.

Overall, Resident Evil 1 Remake is a brilliant update to a classic. It’s scary, atmospheric, and engaging, though its difficulty might not be for everyone. If you’re looking for a horror experience that mixes nostalgia with timeless quality, this is a must-play.

185130955.review:
Janky but still worth playing

Resident Evil HD Remaster remains a visually impressive and surprisingly fun game with its wonderfully gruesome and goofy story, beautifully pre-rendered backgrounds, and neat character designs. Unfortunately, the gameplay feels quite janky by modern standards. The game features a variety of atmospheric locations, several puzzles, and lots of interesting items to collect and utilize. If you can stomach the fixed camera angles and all the quirks, I highly recommend giving this game at least one playthrough.

The environments are both beautifully crafted and at the same time eerily dark, damp, and deteriorated. The mansion can feel like a maze during your first playthrough, which adds to the sense of mystery. The audio design significantly enhances the mood—squeaking floorboards, dripping water, thunder, howling wind, and moaning zombies evoke classic old-school horror movie vibes.

I played through the game for the first time without any guides or mods, but I recommend installing the door animation fix as soon as possible. Those unnecessarily long door-opening animations clearly don’t belong in the remake. The game also has some frustrating issues with colliders. For example, you might aim at a pickup or point of interest and miss it, leading you to think it’s not interactable. This can be especially frustrating since the game doesn’t provide visual highlights for interactive objects. Some doors are also hard to spot, and at least three gave me trouble during my first playthrough.

A couple of puzzles stumped me, and I had to get help. The waterfall puzzle was particularly frustrating, and another one failed simply because of a collider issue—it turned out my aim wasn’t precise enough. The story, however, turned out to be much longer than I expected, which was a pleasant surprise.

Both tank controls and the alternative control scheme are clunky, requiring too much concentration to be enjoyable. These can be of cause learned, but the controls are far from being intuitive. Many of the horror moments come not from atmosphere but from the difficulty of aiming or navigating. You’re often forced to aim at enemies outside the static camera view, which can be frustrating and unintuitive. Overall, combat is the weakest part of the game. Despite being a "survival horror" title, combat often feels more like a test of patience. It’s largely about maneuvering around enemies and trying to get a shot in without getting hit or bitten. Newer Resident Evil remakes handle this aspect much better, so if you’re new to the series, consider starting with Resident Evil 2 Remake instead!

I never played the original game back in the day (despite owning Capcom/RE art books and always liking the series’ concept), nor did I try this version when it first came out. However, it’s easy to see why this game remains so beloved. There are small variations in the story depending on how you play, multiple endings, and the option to start with either Jill or Chris, each offering slightly different gameplay experiences. The game also features three difficulty settings. I naturally started with "Very Easy" to focus on experiencing the story. Completing playthroughs unlocks additional content, like new difficulty modes and alternative costumes.

So if you can look past these issues, RE is still mostly very enjoyable, fun old-school game at its core. Simply don’t expect anything too serious horror stuff, but this game has its share of scary moments.

185101310.review:
[b]Resident Evil HD Remaster breathes new life into the original survival horror masterpiece that started it all. This updated version of the 1996 classic doesn't just polish the visuals, it elevates the entire experience while maintaining the core elements that made the original so iconic. For fans of the genre and newcomers alike, this remaster offers an unforgettable journey into the Spencer Mansion's terrifying corridors.[/b]

[h1]A Return to Survival Horror’s Roots[/h1]
[b]The remaster revisits the classic story of Resident Evil, where players step into the shoes of either Chris Redfield or Jill Valentine, members of the elite S.T.A.R.S. team, sent to investigate mysterious murders on the outskirts of Raccoon City. What follows is a horrifying descent into the heart of the Spencer Mansion, a labyrinth of secrets, puzzles, and grotesque monstrosities.
The game stays true to its roots, focusing on tension, resource management, and environmental storytelling. Even after all these years, the mansion is as haunting and enigmatic as ever.[/b]

[h1]Enhanced Visuals and Atmosphere[/h1]
[b]The updated graphics in the HD Remaster are a standout feature. The pre-rendered backgrounds are beautifully remastered, with enhanced lighting and textures bringing the creepy atmosphere of the Spencer Mansion to life. Shadows flicker, lightning illuminates the dark hallways, and every creak of the floorboards feels more immersive than ever.
The game’s sound design is another highlight, with eerie background music and haunting ambient noises adding to the tension. It’s a game that demands to be played with headphones for the full effect.[/b]

[h1]Refined Controls: Old and New[/h1]
[b]One of the biggest improvements is the addition of modernized controls. The tank controls of the original, while still available for purists, are now complemented by an alternative control scheme that feels more fluid and intuitive. This makes the game more accessible for new players while preserving the challenge and suspense that defined the original.[/b]

[h1]Puzzles and Exploration: Engaging and Rewarding[/h1]
[b]The remaster retains the intricate puzzles and exploration that were a hallmark of the original. From cryptic riddles to hidden keys, each discovery feels satisfying and rewarding. The layout of the mansion itself is a puzzle, with shortcuts, locked doors, and secret pathways that gradually reveal themselves as you progress.[/b]

[h1]Survival Horror at Its Best[/h1]
[b]Resident Evil HD Remaster captures the essence of survival horror. Resources like ammunition and healing items are scarce, forcing players to make strategic choices and manage their inventory carefully. Every encounter with a zombie or monstrous creature feels tense and consequential, with death always lurking around the corner.
The addition of Crimson Heads, zombies that can resurrect into faster, deadlier versions if not disposed of properly, adds a new layer of fear and strategy, ensuring that even areas you thought were “safe” remain a source of dread.[/b]

[h1]Pros:[/h1]
[list]
[*]Stunning visual overhaul: Pre-rendered backgrounds and lighting effects look gorgeous and atmospheric.
[*]Refined controls: The addition of modern controls makes the game more accessible.
[*]Classic survival horror: Maintains the tension, resource management, and puzzle-solving that define the genre.
[*]Improved sound design: Creepy ambient noises and music enhance the eerie atmosphere.
[*]Faithful to the original: Captures the essence of what made the original Resident Evil a masterpiece.
[*]Crimson Heads: A chilling new twist to the zombie threat.
[*]Multiple playthroughs encouraged: With two characters (Chris and Jill), different endings, and challenging modes, replayability is high.
[/list]
[h1]Cons:[/h1]
[list]
[*]Fixed camera angles: While iconic, they can feel dated to some players and make combat tricky.
[*]Limited inventory space: Adds to the challenge but can be frustrating at times.
[*]Pace may feel slow: The deliberate pacing and backtracking might not appeal to players unfamiliar with older games.
[*]No major story changes: Veterans of the original may find little new content in terms of narrative.
[*]Lack of accessibility options: Limited features for modern accessibility standards.
[/list]
[h1]Conclusion:[/h1]
[b]Resident Evil HD Remaster is a masterclass in remaking a classic. It preserves the charm and terror of the original while improving on its visuals, controls, and overall presentation. This is survival horror at its finest, with a haunting atmosphere, engaging puzzles, and relentless tension that keeps you on the edge of your seat.
For longtime fans, it’s a nostalgic trip back to the Spencer Mansion with a fresh coat of paint. For newcomers, it’s a fantastic way to experience one of gaming’s most influential titles. Despite a few dated mechanics, the remaster is a must-play for anyone looking to explore the roots of survival horror. Just remember: in the world of Resident Evil, every bullet and every step matters.[/b]

184873974.review:
This is such an enjoyable game and I hope Capcom find some way to bring back this formula with future games or spin-offs.

It is a rather basic survival horror experience, but a good one, that being said, while this version still has some funny and awkward cutscenes with some less than spectacular Voice Acting, it doesn't hold a candle to the gloriously atrocious mess that is the PS1 voice work.

Game also still looks rather amazing (even with the botched upscale of all the backgrounds, for which I recommend downloading a mod) and it plays and controls exactly like it needs to, to give you that perfect mid point between fear and a rush of action.

Jill and Chris are also fun to play as individually, as they're both essentially a hidden difficulty select: with Jill having 8 inventory slots, exclusive access to the Grenade Launcher and a Lockpick that allows her to force open certain doors; while Chris has 6 inventory slots, has to look for keys (that take up inventory space) to open doors that Jill can force open, but he can tank a lot more damage, is faster overall, has the option to have Rebecca heal him at certain points and has a higher chance of getting criticals. [h1]Pontos Positivos[/h1]
Gráficos melhorados, tendo suas texturas e modelos atualizados para HD, melhorando a imersão.
O game mantem a jogabilidade clássica de mecânicas de survival horror originais, com controle de câmera fixa e puzzles.
Temos a mesma atmosfera sombria, com uma iluminação superior ao clássico, trazendo uma boa imersão.
A narrativa original de Chris Redfield e Jill Valentine permanece emocionante além de termos ali personagens secundárias na campanha de cada um, como Barry e Rebecca. O desenrolar com Wesker (Albert Wesker) e como surge como grande FDP haha.
Preço acessível, mas muito mais justo em uma promoção.
Diversos níveis de dificuldade.

[h1]Pontos Negativos[/h1]
O estilo da câmera fixa torna a gameplay datada para que não teve experiências nos jogos clássicos.
A limitação de inventário tornam visitas a safe rooms constantes se não souber fazer uma gestão de seus itens.
Mesmo sendo um remaster, considerando a idade do jogo, eu disse que o preço é justo, mas poderia ser ainda mais.
Não possuí legendas em português infelizmente (por isso utilizei um mod de tradução).

[h1]Conclusão[/h1]

RE1 HD Remaster te leva de volta no tempo para uma experiência única e nostálgica para jogadores já habituados com a série e é uma porta de entrada para quem quiser se aventurar e conhecer o início de tudo (falando da história do game e a evolução de sua gameplay).

A dificuldade do game é bem tranquila e o que torna um maior desafio é apenas se acostumar com a câmera fixa e a mira. Dependendo da dificuldade, é possível manter um auxilio de mira (O que torna a experiência mais amigável para novatos).

O fator replay desafia apenas quem busca dificuldades mais elevadas e platina (mas não é uma platina difícil).

Não tem muito mais o que dizer né? Estou falando de Resident Evil! Compra logo e mete as caras!

184420228.review:
First, let me clarify: This is just another port of the RE HD Remaster, so there’s not much to critique about this specific version. It runs smoothly and still looks gorgeous, even after all these years. And the modern controls still break this game similar to how Full Active Mode breaks the combat system in Star Ocean 3. That’s about it. Instead of reviewing this particular release of REmake1, I’ll share my thoughts on the game as a whole:

Obviously, REmake1 is a must-play for anyone who enjoys classic survival horror. Personally, I’ve played, completed, and 100%-ed this game countless times since its original release on the Nintendo GameCube. It’s a prime example of how to remake a game, and also of how to do classic survival horror right. At least, that’s what I thought.

However, when I played it again on Steam, I started to notice its weird pacing. The game feels somewhat stretched out in parts - if you know what I mean. Some of the improvements are great, but the game often has you running back and forth between two points way too many times. I’m not talking about returning to the mansion with a new key - I’m talking about literally running between two locations that are only four or five rooms apart. Then there are other annoyances, like not being allowed to run while carrying the nitro. There’s the broken door handle, the repetitive trips in the underground tunnels to get that broken flamethrower, and the frustrating statue puzzle to get the cylinder shaft. Overall there are just way too many slow and repetative parts, where you have to push stuff. And none of the puzzles requires any real thinking either.

Usually, in RE, after collecting all the trophies, I do one last perfect run with each character, gathering every item along the way and putting them in a nice order within the item box. But with REmake1, I skipped doing that with Chris because I was already fed up with the game’s odd pacing. I even had to resort to outfit mods and mods that skip the door animations to make the nine playthroughs a little more tolerable.

[u]Resident Evil[/u]

Primogênito e atemporal, não existe maneira melhor de descrever Resident Evil, mesmo com as limitações geracionais e de gameplay, que por sinal foram bem atenuadas com esse remake espetacular e certamente um dos melhores da história. Resident Evil é um dos ápices do survival horror, toda a estrutura de gameplay que a maior parte dos fãs da franquia tanto amam já estão presentes aqui, a atmosfera tensa e misteriosa, o backtracking, gerenciamento de recursos e puzzles.

A história é boa, simples para quem já jogou outros jogos da franquia, mas ainda sim muito boa especialmente lendo os files deixados pelo caminho. Confesso que no tocante a dificuldade esperava um pouco mais pelos comentários da maioria, não existe tanta escassez de munição e cura, se souber gerenciar os recursos de maneira mínima não vai ter dificuldade com falta de recursos, a maior dificuldade é realmente a câmera fixa e aos que quiserem utilizar, o controle tanque.

A platina também me surpreendeu positivamente, esperava que fosse mais maçante e difícil do que a dos outros Resident Evil, mas não é, o número de runs é alto mas o jogo é bem curto se souber fazer o caminho certo, os dois achievements mais chatos são os de completar no modo Real Survivor por conta dos baús não estarem linkados (recomendo fortemente fazer o Real Survivor com a JIll) e o de pegar todas as skins, mas no geral, é bem tranquilo. Tive a grata surpresa de conhecer um canal excelente que faz diversos guias de Resident Evil, utilizei para fazer a speedrun com a Jill, fica a minha recomendação para utilizar os guias e facilitar a platina:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vLyuWiCVkOQ&t=4187s

Essa foi minha primeira vez zerando o game e confesso que terminei a platina muito feliz por ter dado finalmente uma chance para esse clássico, no geral não posso deixar de recomendar para todos os fãs de survival horror, mesmo os que tem certo preconceito com a câmera fixa e a jogabilidade um pouco datada.

Nota: 9.25/10

184104676.review:
The survival mechanics of Resident Evil are rock solid. The game takes place in an enclosed space with limited resources which are often dangerous to obtain, especially if you haven't cleared the enemies or, worse yet, killed the zombies without burning them or destroying their heads.
Backtracking is not only dangerous but necessary due to the limited inventory and manual saving system so there are real choices to be made when it comes to moving around the mansion, what enemies to avoid, which ones to kill, and, perhaps most important of all, when to save.
This last aspect is what prevents me from saying that Resident Evil is perfect (the game is that good) because a new player has no way of knowing ahead of time how often they should save. 
For those who don't know, saving is a limited resource in Resident Evil because it requires ink ribbons that the player needs to find like any other item. This helps enhance the tension but it also promotes exploring as far as you can go, making notes of what you need to do and then reloading to try and maximize how much you do with each save. This is clearly overkill since you can save pretty comfortably and with ribbons to spare every 15-20 minutes (probably 5 on very easy) but I had no idea as a new player. Perhaps this says more about my own personality, but I digress.
The rest of the gameplay is quite good. Even the original tank controls have been retouched with the ability to do a quick turn and I think I prefer them over the modern setting for playing on a keyboard. There isn't much to say about the combat since aiming is largely automatic, it's more about the resource management aspect (ammo and inventory space in this case).
The presentation is nothing short of fantastic. Even the rejected concept art for this game was great, the mansion is beautiful and I love the sound effects.
To conclude, it was hard for me to get into the game but I'm glad I stuck around because it's totally worth it.

184029467.review:
After playing the original masterpiece Resident Evil back in 1995, I found this remastered HD edition very tiring at some points. The game was extended with new locations and other things, but that also made it a lot more boring due to the back-and-forth necessity to get items and solve puzzles. I'd prefer to see a *real* remastered edition of 1995's RE, with bigger resolutions and improved graphics instead of a game with outdated resolutions that use the same old graphics retouched and badly upscaled; and a strange 3D mix implementation that not always fit them.

I am still a fan of Resident Evil, so replaying this remastered edition 30 years later makes me admit that the original was much scarier and fun to play than this one. Unconditional lovers will always debate what I'm saying, but, frankly, the HD edition didn't convince me much and doesn't stand as a decent honor to the original of 1995. The new contents added didn't really added more interest; only boredom and tiredness in most of the times.

I can recommend this game to survival horror fans just because it's pretty playable and has a good atmosphere, but I'll leave a note that in an overall comparison with 1995's original, it doesn't beat it. Not even close.

생각보다 재밌게 즐겼습니다. 바이오 하자드 시리즈에는 그렇게 흥미가 없어서 1편이 어떤 게임인지 잘 모르고 있었는데 우연히 한 유튜버가 플레이하는 화면을 보고 바로 시청을 중지하고 이건 직접 플레이해야겠다고 생각했습니다. 리메이크된 시리즈보다는 덜하지만 그럼에도 리마스터를 하면서 충분히 좋다고 느껴지는 그래픽과 고전 게임이라는 사실을 여지없이 드러내는 특유의 cctv 시야가 특히 저의 흥미를 끌었던 것 같습니다. 
사실 플레이하기 전부터 저 특유의 시야는 걱정이 많이 되었습니다. 저런 시야의 게임이라고는 헤비 레인과 디트로이트 비컴 휴먼처럼 컨트롤이 필요없는 아주 정적인 스토리 게임에서나 해봤지 바이오 하자드같이 생존 공포게임에서는 해본 적이 없었기 때문입니다. 실제로도 플레이하는 내내 이 시야는 적응하기 힘들더군요. 그렇지 않아도 장소를 이곳저곳 돌아다니면서 퍼즐을 풀거나 괴물이 쫓아오면 도망가야되는 이 게임의 특징 상 캐릭터의 위치에 따라 시야가 자주 확확 바뀔수 밖에 없었는데, 아주 가끔가다가 시야때문에 가고 싶은 곳을 빠르게 못 가거나 몬스터 앞에서 얼타다가 죽는 경우가 발생해서 이 부분은 좀 아쉬웠습니다. 그럼에도 이 특유의 시야 덕분에 게임을 플레이하는 내내 긴장을 놓을 수 없어서 오히려 게임에 몰입이 더 잘되는 듯한 느낌을 받을 수 있어서 좋았습니다. 저 멀리 시야가 사각인 곳에서 좀비가 다가오는 소리만 들린다거나 다가오는 좀비의 위치를 시야에 담기 위해 좀비에게 더 가까운 곳으로 가야하는 순간마다 생존 공포 게임에서 이 시야가 줄 수 있는 재미를 느낄 수 있어서 좋았습니다. 게다가 특유의 cctv 시야 덕분에 항상 같은 시점에서 보이는게 아닌, 각 장소마다의 시점을 볼 수 있어서 가끔 멋있는 각도가 나오면 사진을 찍기도 했습니다.
그리고 그래픽은 극소수의 컷신을 제외하면 전부 리마스터가 된 깔끔한 비주얼을 볼 수 있어서 좋았습니다. 그렇게 막 엄청나게 좋은 그래픽은 아니지만 그럼에도 디테일이 들어가야하는 부분은 잘 들어가있어서 게임에 몰입을 더 잘 할 수 있어서 좋았습니다. 스토리는 이해하기 쉬우면서도 파고들어갈 요소가 있어서 좋았고, 저택을 돌아다니면서 퍼즐을 푸는 플레이 방식은 그렇게 어렵지 않으면서 적당하게 어려워서 좋았습니다. 공략을 보지 않고 플레이를 하다가 완전히 막혔을 때만 공략을 보면서 진행을 했는데, 완전히 공략없이 진행을 했다면 아마 저는 많이 어려웠을 것 같습니다. 그리고 세이브 횟수가 제한이 있다보니 약간 소울라이크를 플레이하는 듯한 느낌이 들어서 꽤 신선한 경험이었습니다.
오랜만에 이런 클래식한 고전 게임을 플레이할 수 있어서 즐거웠고, 이 게임을 플레이하면서 바이오 하자드 시리즈의 매력을 알게 되어서 좋았습니다. 이후에 나온 re 시리즈들도 다시 한번 플레이하거나 이번 기회에 사서 플레이를 해봐야겠습니다.

183840844.review: Was it a good game for its time? Yes. Is it a good game by today's standards: arguable. It has good mechanics, and you can see its influence on other games across the medium going forward. Graphics are fine, but the control scheme is a large point of frustration, and I only leave this review because I am confident that anyone else who buys this will also be largely frustrated by the controls and fixed cameras and lack the perseverance to push on, and end up wasting the money spent on it. As a note, only ~20% of the people that own this game have beaten it based on Steam Achievements. There are good bones in this, but the flesh has rotted over time.

183628027.review:
A very nice game that can take some time getting used to. My first ever proper Resident Evil game, I initially started as Jill on Normal Difficulty, and quickly found myself running out of ammo and getting killed. I ended up beating my first game on Very Easy, which indeed felt too easy in comparison. My second playthrough was as Chris on Easy and I found it decently challenging while not too hard, as once you have explored the entire game in your first playthrough, every other one will be much less tedious.

The biggest tips a new player can get are to avoid killing enemies that aren't in the way, and to not pick up everything you see unless you know for sure you need to. The former helps to avoid unnecessarily wasting ammo and getting hurt in fights you shouldn't be getting into, and the latter helps you not need to constantly backtrack and run through the same halls to make trips to the nearest item box, which quickly becomes a huge slog to do. Resident Evil is not a typical action game, and this one especially has a heavy usage of puzzles and strategy, and trying to play like a typical shooter will be frustrating.

Overall, Resident Evil Remake is a very good game once you get used to the controls, combat, and understand the kind of mindset the game wants you to play with.

Porém apesar de todas as adversidades AMO O JOGO, estou me esforçando ao máximo e sinto que era isso que faltava em minhas jogatinas recentes, a vontade de dar tudo de mim em um jogo e experienciar a dificuldade e os quebra-cabeças me deixa com vontade de quero mais, obviamente fico preso as vezes e dependo de uma ajuda como o youtube ou um blog, mas a comunidade é muito interativa e reciproca quando se trata de ajudar, já que muitos já ficaram ou ficam presos em certas partes que por exemplo eu passei com facilidade. Logo tenho só coisas boas a dizer desse jogo, entre nessa experiência e sinta-se feliz em morrer as vezes e recomeçar, porque as vezes é melhor refazer do que fazer porcamente. Minha nota é 10/10, tem terror (o jogo é de 2014 com gráficos medianos pra época se parar pra pensar e me deu CALAFRIOS mano, bizarro como uma simples animação de porta abrindo pode te amedrontar), o áudio do jogo e BIZARRO de perfeito, tanto as falas como o ambiente, por exemplo, se você andar na madeira faz um som de pisar forte em madeira, mas a partir do momento que você encosta no carpete o som fica abafado, simplesmente ÉPICO, a "dublagem" em inglês é CINEMA, tipo ajuda de mais a forma como eles falam para você ficar entretido na história e você sente a emoção e o sentimento do personagem no momento, os gráficos são bons, podiam ser melhores em minha opinião, mas a estética ta perfeita então não mudaria nada. ABSOLUTE CINEMA!

183525448.review:
[b]Where it all began[/b]... well sort of.

This is a remaster of one of the most iconic games in history, Resident Evil. From updated visuals and controls, this is a wonderful way to introduce new-comers to the series, but also keeping close to it's roots. And if you're feeling particularly nostalgic, or if you don't have skill issues like me, you can opt to use the original control scheme, the infamous tank controls.

If this is you're first rodeo with the Resident Evil (Biohazard) series, the basics is this; you play as either S.T.A.R.S. member Jill "Sandwich" Valentine or Chris "Boulder-puncher" Redfield. Both have different abilities, such as Jill having more inventory space or Chris having more health (Pick Jill). You will explore a large mansion estate, solving puzzles and unlocking doors as you investigate the disappearance of fellow comrades and questioning the architect who designed this mansion. You'll also encounter enemies, from zombies to oversized snakes. You'll need to find resources to help combat these foes: ammunition, weapons, and herbs for healing. However, resources and your inventory space is limited, so it's not wise to dump all your bullets into every zombie you come across. You will have to pick and choose your battles, especially in the beginning. If you like me at the end you'll probably just start shooting everything. 

The game plays in fixed camera angles, unlike modern Resident Evil games. But I think that helps add to the tension, not being able to see what's around the corner. But please keep that in mind if your not a fan of that.

So, if you like survival horror, why not give the father of all survival horror a try?
